comments.body: What is this for? kubectl is not used at all by ansible, afaik

I didnt' add it, it comes from: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/f73996e6ebc25a453caef3631558fca6e1af4a4e/lib/ansible/module_utils/k8s/inventory.py#L40

It is used there in order to define connection plugin (`kubectl` or `oc`) which will be used with the generated inventory:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/f73996e6ebc25a453caef3631558fca6e1af4a4e/lib/ansible/module_utils/k8s/inventory.py#L161-L167

`kubectl` is a valid connection plugin, without looking into the code further I assume that's being used as the transport backend in that inventory plugin.

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/plugins/connection/kubectl.py
